title: Filesystem Integrity Checking (AIDE)
overview: <paragraph>AIDE is a file integrity checking tool, similar in nature to Tripwire. While it cannot prevent intrusions, it can detect unauthorised changes to configuration files by alerting when the files are changed. When setting up AIDE, decide internally what the site policy will be concerning integrity checking. Review the AIDE quick start guide and AIDE documentation before proceeding.</paragraph>
remediation: <paragraph>Ensure AIDE is installed</paragraph><paragraph>Run the following command to install aide:</paragraph><paragraph># yum install aide</paragraph><paragraph>Configure AIDE as appropriate for your environment. Consult the AIDE documentation for options.</paragraph><paragraph>Initialize AIDE:</paragraph><paragraph># aide --init</paragraph><paragraph># mv /var/lib/aide/aide.db.new.gz /var/lib/aide/aide.db.gz</paragraph><paragraph></paragraph><paragraph>Ensure filesystem integrity is regularly checked</paragraph><paragraph>Run the following command:</paragraph><paragraph># crontab -u root -e</paragraph><paragraph>Add the following line to the crontab:</paragraph><paragraph>0 5 * * * /usr/sbin/aide --check</paragraph>
